body.p:
Oldtown Ridge
Apl 13th 1861
Geo W. Johnson Esq
Dr Sir

I regreted very much that the Bill of exchange went to protest, In fact felt so bad about it, I would not come to see you whilst in Kentucky in regard to the deeds of the lands traded, but will arrange it early next Fall by shiping enough of my first cotton to some other house, to satisfy both amounts that is due,
